comment: It was less the professor and more the course that is out of control. Many of the resources linked throughout the course are broken and such. He also will only open the modules on Monday, which is annoying, especially when he forgot to and the course fell one week behind. He wasn't a bad person, but didn't really seem to be on top of things.

He's nice and gives good feedback. I think he is very knowledgeable and genuinely cares. There were three assignments spread out into different sections. I took 17 credits (seven classes including labs)  this semester and this class made the load feel a lot lighter. definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Seems particular but is not a harsh grader and not difficult. He has a personality that some might like and others might not. Good critic. Only tedious thing for this class was the group project. No tests just papers (1,250max), and a couple short quizzes. Attendance is not mandatory but there are some days he does take for a grade (3ish).
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Atakpa is the best college professor I've ever had. His classes were very fun and his lectures were very engaging. You can also choose about what you write about for your assignments.

A pretty chill, nice, and sarcastic guy! Show up to class cause he randomly gives in-class work and extra credit. Quizzes were kinda tricky so pay attention to lectures/readings closely. DO YOUR COURSE MEETINGS, TRUST ME (it doesn't have to be long and that grade boost/feedback was everythingggg).
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: You will get discreet comments on rough drafts, which assist you to compose the well-rounded final draft. This cannot be done without the cool professor.

Dude is mad chill and funny asf. He gives phenomenal feedback and opportunities to improve your research paper by going Infront of the class and showing what you got. I liked his laid-back teaching style and that he is comfortable enough to cuss around us students. Fun class would take again

Professor Atakpa cares and does want you to improve in his class. He is pretty sarcastic in his humor, just something to note. There aren't many assignments, just three big things really (annotated bib, research proposal, final paper). He will occasionally pick people to call on during class to answer questions, but it isn't often.
Really good teacher and super fun and easy class definitely would recommend taking

Best English instructor I've had. He has an unhinged sense of humor, but he means well. Aside from his sporadic jokes, he cares about his students and will always give amazing help for you. He will take his time if you need to stay after class for assistance. Although attendance isn't mandatory, show up because he may open an assignment (its easy).

The whole class would be progressions toward a final paper. Although you really don't have to attend all of his classes, I would still suggest to go because he would introduce assignments that are not always announced on D2L. Those assignments are easy A's too, so I would take advantage of them to spare for the final paper.

If you don't have a sense of humor, I don't want you to be surprised by his class. He's a great professor, knows what he is talking about, and is very understanding. He makes sure nobody is left behind and he is always willing to clarify anything. Show up to class because sometimes his attendance is random and it does count for a grade.

The only thing that really matters is the research paper. He is funny but with a bit of a weird sense of humor. He isn't mean to students or anything but will definitely call them out sometimes in a joking way. Don't be afraid to ask questions about the paper cause it really is the only grade.
really great, only a couple quizzes and 3 papers. quizzes are based off reading but its open note. attendance wasn't mandatory but I would go. he really wants his students to do well!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is the unexpected I took in my freshmen year. Didn't expect him to be laid back lol
Professor Atakpa was great! Very caring about students and very funny! He always made class interesting. It was always worth going to!
Best English professor I have ever had, if you show up to class and put in a solid amount of work on your writings he will make sure you get an A. Highly recommend taking him.

Professor Atakpa was a very funny teacher. He really made this class fun even though it was an 8am. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he does give extra credit for coming some day. There aren't many assignments for this class so you have to do very good on the assignments. He is also very nit picky on citations, but he was a pretty chill teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: He canceled a lot of classes but all you have to do in the class is write a research paper. there are a few quizzes. He does cuss a lot but it's an easy class and he helps you write the paper so. I wouldn't take his class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Atakpa was amazing. He cancels class a lot but is overall chill. He only uses 1 textbook and we found a free link online but I never even read it honestly and still passed. He does give grades for being in class so I highly recommend going. 10/10 overall I highly recommend.

Easy class if u do the work. Professor makes unnecessary comments to students that are not related to the class at all (about appearance and personality). He also will try to make students feel stupid. Idk if this semester was just bad for him but he would just be rude to me and other students for no reason.

So unorganized, swears at students, nightmare class, cancels constantly (15 minutes before). One assignment due the whole semester other than random quizzes. Can be tough on your grade with so few assignments. Be prepared to waste time sitting in class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Atakpa is very funny and relatable. He makes his class quite enjoyable for what would otherwise be a very boring music class. Amount of work is pretty reasonable and manageable. You'll learn while also not becoming super overwhelmed. Highly recommend him if you get the chance.
Very blunt when going over your work, but points out lots of details that will help improve your paper. Easily available and willing to help you improve. Very sarcastic but gets the job done.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He is so funny! I love him as a person, but I can't comprehend the work we're doing. He gave us one assignment a week, but I wouldn't be good at projects because I didn't understand. There is one big paper. Attendance is not mandatory, but I recommend going for the extra credit opportunities. I thought I was good at English until I took this class.

He is amazing, so funny, & makes lectures entertaining. Took him for ENGL 1101 & 1102 and don't regret it at all. Loved going to his class. Seriously hes amazing I can't recommend him enough. He's so caring & very understanding of ur circumstances & does whatever he can to help. Always encouraged us & gives a lot of freedom when it comes to essays.

I really enjoyed his class. He was very engaging and funny. He's very understanding and seems to really love his job. He never overcomplicates anything and there were not a lot of assignments. I would recommend taking him.

He's pretty close in age with the students so right off the back he's super chill. Easy A if you complete your work on time & follow are criterias in the assignments. Does offer extra credits. Classes were super fun and he made it very entertaining. Take him if you're just trying to get easy credits, but would not recommend if you're an ENGL major

Professor Atakpa is great, he's pretty easy and the class is very enjoyable. I would recommend him to everyone. There are 3 major assignments (annotated bibliography/research proposal/research paper). Attendance isn't "mandatory" but he will do in class assignments for a grade so if you won't be in class you just need to let him know beforehand.

Very down to Earth and easy going professor. Very personal and always available via e-mail. Lectures were short, yet useful and applicable. There was never a drab day, and it is clear that he is quite knowledgeable.

Hes very chill but can be really straight-forward and brutally honest during class and with feedback. He has random attendance grades so just show up, hes really open to any questions in class and through email. He has participation tickets near the end of the semester to redeem on the last day, and hes overall a great teacher, just do the work.

Ime is a very caring professor and will do anything to make sure you succeed. Hes also hilarious. However, I would make sure you come into the class with thick skin because he is very upfront and will not hold back with feedback. I would recommend going to class because he grades attendance on random days.

This man is amazing!!!!!! 10/10! He cares about what he teaches and his students. Very shy and dry humor but I love him he always made my day. If you ever need help just talk to him he is super flexible and kind and willing to help you get the best grade. I wish all of my professors were like him.

Great professor! Amazing class and made everyday enjoyable. Even if you don't like writing or english you will enjoy his class. No attendance policy and really cares about you as an individual. Easy essays and a chapter quiz here and there. I really recommend him.

Ime Atakpa was a great professor. His lectures were not the best because he would just talk for the majority of the time and it was kind of boring (mainly because I find the content boring). He was easy to reach and super understanding. He gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. There are 4 papers and some quizzes that were pretty wack.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: His lectures aren't the best but he's a very relatable & down to earth teacher. It took me a while to understand the way he teaches but his video lectures help. The quizzes are like 8 questions which would be hard to pass if you don't know everything but overall a pretty good teacher
Great teacher one of my favorites ive ever had. Really teaches english how it should be taught.

Really tries to connect to students and really makes you try and think about your research topic. His lectures seemed random (but fun) but always circled back to "research". He really is there for you if you need it. Gives good feedback about papers but you have to decide how to change that feedback.

Professor Atakpa has an amazing class and really tries to help all of his students. Work is a must because the things that he gives you typically have carry alot of grading weight, the work is also fairly easy. He also tries his best to accommodate the entire class since my entire class played video games he found a way to incorporate that.

Personally, I had a lot of struggles this semester with mental health and other things, but Mr. Atakpa was very understanding. His course was very engaging, the essays involved self-reflection which helped a lot, and he gave real-life examples for most of what he taught. His class wasn't difficult and I was actually able to take something away from

He is genuinely caring and wants you to make good in his class. You definitely have to do the work he assigns but it's never too difficult. He works with the class to provide an overall favorable class experience
The perfect combination of laid back and strict!
